body:
The developer guidelines say to use the `#include <...>` form **when possible**. It's not clear to me when it wouldn't be possible.

If it's always possible, ACK on enforcing it.
@sipa @promag Good point! Updated the developer guidelines :-)

diff_hunk:
@@ -4,10 +4,12 @@
 # Distributed under the MIT software license, see the accompanying
 # file COPYING or http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php.
 #
-# Check for duplicate includes.
+# Check includes: Check for duplicate includes. Enforce bracket syntax includes.
+
+IGNORE_REGEXP="(leveldb|secp256k1|univalue)/"

@@ -4,10 +4,12 @@
 # Distributed under the MIT software license, see the accompanying
 # file COPYING or http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php.
 #
-# Check for duplicate includes.
+# Check includes: Check for duplicate includes. Enforce bracket syntax includes.
+
+IGNORE_REGEXP="(leveldb|secp256k1|univalue)/"

body: Including a cpp file seems extremely wrong. (I know this is not your fault, just leaving a note)

diff_hunk:
@@ -97,4 +100,12 @@ for EXPECTED_BOOST_INCLUDE in "${EXPECTED_BOOST_INCLUDES[@]}"; do
     fi
 done
 
+QUOTE_SYNTAX_INCLUDES=$(git grep '^#include "' -- "**/*.cpp" "**/*.h" | grep -Ev "${IGNORE_REGEXP}")
body: Why not use `*.cpp` and `*.h`? Isn't it compatible with other git versions?

diff_hunk:
@@ -97,4 +100,12 @@ for EXPECTED_BOOST_INCLUDE in "${EXPECTED_BOOST_INCLUDES[@]}"; do
     fi
 done
 
+QUOTE_SYNTAX_INCLUDES=$(git grep '^#include "' -- "**/*.cpp" "**/*.h" | grep -Ev "${IGNORE_REGEXP}")
body: Yes, you're right that `-- "*.cpp" "*.h"` would be equivalent in this specific case (since we're only matching in `src/`), but my suggestions is that we keep this PR as is since it already has two utACK:s that would need re-reviewing in case of a change. Makes sense? :-)
This doesn't compile locally here. Should be `#include <bench/bench.h>`

diff_hunk:
@@ -97,4 +100,12 @@ for EXPECTED_BOOST_INCLUDE in "${EXPECTED_BOOST_INCLUDES[@]}"; do
     fi
 done
 
+QUOTE_SYNTAX_INCLUDES=$(git grep '^#include "' -- "**/*.cpp" "**/*.h" | grep -Ev "${IGNORE_REGEXP}")

body: It includes `blockchain.h` previously, but you include `blockchain.cpp`. Might because of #13288 merged.
Ouch, now fixed! Thanks for catching this. I missed the `.cpp` extension!
